title: Takis Parafestas
text:
Dimitrios "Takis" Parafestas (; born 16 August 1953) is a Greek former <a href="soccer">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28football%29">defender</a>.
He started his career from <a href="Falaniakos">Falaniakos</a> and spent the majority of it with <a href="Larissa%20FC">AEL</a> in the <a href="Greek%20Super%20League">Greek Super League</a>.
International career.
Parafestas appeared in one match for the senior <a href="Greece%20national%20football%20team">Greece national football team</a>, a friendly against East Germany on 15 February 1984. In 2003, when Larissa were playing in <a href="Football%20League%202%20%28Greece%29">Third Division</a> and were in the relegation zone, he was appointed manager of the club, managed to save the club from relegation in the last match of the season after taking a point at <a href="Chania">Chania</a> in a 3–3 draw against the local club AE Chania. Next season he managed to promote the club to <a href="Football%20League%20%28Greece%29">Football League (Greece)</a> and then he resigned.
